intro: Amomis anisomera, commonly known as the narrow-leafed bitterroot, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its roots are often harvested for their medicinal properties, containing compounds used in traditional herbal remedies. Amomis anisomera thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in sagebrush steppe ecosystems.
